<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 119, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 194, 201]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 170, 250]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 242, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0580/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 302, 905, 317]]<|/det|>
May/June 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[752, 326, 905, 342]]<|/det|>
1 hour 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 480, 543]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 333, 559]]<|/det|>
You may use tracing paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 470, 574]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 855, 605]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 490, 620]]<|/det|>
For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 219, 666]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 384, 682]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 70.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 729, 698]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 106, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 638, 91]]<|/det|>
The interior angles of a pentagon are in the ratio \(4:5:5:7:9\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 378, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the size of the largest angle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 291, 920, 308]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 335, 106, 353]]<|/det|>
<label>13</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 658, 353]]<|/det|>
Work out \(2 \times 10^{100} - 2 \times 10^{98}\) , giving your answer in standard form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 505, 920, 524]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 553, 104, 571]]<|/det|>
<label>14</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 552, 546, 571]]<|/det|>
A train passes through a station at a speed of \(108\mathrm{km / h}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 567, 384, 586]]<|/det|>
The length of the station is \(120\mathrm{m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 583, 621, 602]]<|/det|>
The train takes 7 seconds to completely pass through the station.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 613, 369, 632]]<|/det|>
Work out the length of the train.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 832, 920, 850]]<|/det|>
<form>............................................ m [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>25</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 432, 89]]<|/det|>
\(w\) is proportional to the square root of \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 87, 358, 104]]<|/det|>
\(y\) is inversely proportional to \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 374, 120]]<|/det|>
When \(x = 4\), \(y = 16\) and \(w = 8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 282, 151]]<|/det|>
Find \(w\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 350, 923, 368]]<|/det|>
<form>w = .................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 395, 102, 413]]<|/det|>
<label>26</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 411, 923, 562]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 580, 611, 598]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a triangle \(OAB\) and a parallelogram \(OALK\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 596, 598, 613]]<|/det|>
The position vector of \(A\) is \(\mathbf{a}\) and the position vector of \(B\) is \(\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 611, 460, 628]]<|/det|>
\(K\) is a point on \(AB\) so that \(AK:KB = 1:2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 642, 504, 660]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(L\), in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 658, 420, 675]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in its simplest form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 858, 923, 876]]<|/det|>
<form>............................................ [4]
